column4: hey people. What exactly does /etc/cron.daily/apt do? I know what a cron job does, but where does this particular one come from?
did you try reading it?  It has some comments at the top
yes, it 255 lines long
not the comments at the top
it only explains a couple of configuration options, but not where I can set them
man apt.conf   would be my guess
thanks. Didn't know it was there
0.94 is what I see in intrepid's repositories.  What ubuntu version are you using?
sorry I meant hardy

usually security patches are cherrypicked, so the version you are using probably already has the security patches from 0.94 (check the changelog).  See: https://bugs.edge.launchpad.net/ubuntu/hardy/+source/clamav/+bug/296704
yeah but I remember from previous experiences that clamav always complains if you don't update it
I don't use clamav.  Is it complaining?
I didn't install yet. I assumed it would be since I experienced that before. I'll see first before wasting time :)
I know debian has a volatile repository with clamav because of the clamav complaints when it 's not the newest version
the bug mentions some ppa, but I would try with the default repositories first
apt-cache policy clamav   shows what version?
Installed: 0.92.1~dfsg2-1.1ubuntu0.4
why is that useless?
did you see if the changelog mentions the 0.94 changes?
since new virusses get released all the time that first try to disable the virusscanner so it can't be detected, even if the scanner knows about it.

I really doubt that happens on linux, but like I said, security fixes are cherrypicked into -updates.  That's why I am asking you to check the changelog of the version you have now to see if it mentions the bug I linked you to
https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-motu/2008-December/005068.html mail mentioning the ppa in the bug report
thanks for the info
